citations.narrative:
The licensee was unable to provide a written contingency plan during the inspection.
If an emergency or natural disaster were to occur at the facility, the lack of a documented contingency plan could impact
animal health if the licensee is not prepared to respond to the situation appropriately.
Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate contingency plan to provide for the humane handling,
treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the the event of an emergency or disaster.
Correct by: January 24, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The licensee was unable to provide a written contingency plan during the inspection.  
If an emergency or natural disaster were to occur at the facility, the lack of a documented contingency plan could impact 
animal health if the licensee is not prepared to respond to the situation appropriately. 
Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate contingency plan to provide for the humane handling, 
treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the the event of an emergency or disaster. 
Correct by: January 24, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
